intro: Disadena flavescens, commonly known as the yellow disadena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Disadena flavescens is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodland edges and wetlands.
